div.l:
Whan that Aple Aprile
wt with his shorris sote
The drought of March hath prid perced to þe rote
And bathid every veyn in suis swiche licour
Of which vertue engendrid is þe flour
Whan zephirus eke with his swete brethe
Inspirid hath in every holt and hethe
The tendir croppis and the yong snne sonne
Hath in the ramme his half course y rnne ronne
And smale foules maken melodie
That slepen all night with open iye
So prikith hem nature in her courage courages
Than longen folk to go on pilgrimage pilgrimages
And palmere to sechen straunge stronde strondes
To fne ferne halows couth in sundrie lande londes
And speciali from every shiris ende
Of Englond to cauntirbury they wende
The holi blisful martir forto seke
That hem hath holpen whan thei wer seke
Befill that in that seson upon a day
In Suthwerk at the Tabard as I lay
Redi to wende on my pilgremage
To cauntirbury wtwith devout courage
At night were come into that hostirye
Wele nyne and twenti in a cumpany
Of sundrie folc bi aventure y falle
In felaship and pilgmespilgrimes were thei all
That toward cauntirbury wolden ride
The chambirs and the stables wer wide
And wel we weren easid at the best
And shotli whan the snnesonne was to rest
So had spoken wtwithhem evychoneevrychone
That I was of her felaship anone
And made forwird erli forto rise
To take oure weye as I did devise
But natheles whils that I have time & space
Or that I further in this tale pace
Me think it accordinnt unto reson
To telle you alle the condicion
Of eche of them so as it semed me
And which ther were and of what degre
And eke what array that thei wer in
And at knight than wil I first begyn
A knight ther was & þat a worthi ma man
That fro time that he first began
To ride out he loved chevalrye
Trouth honour fredam and curtesy
Fful wourthie was he in his lordis werre
And þtothereto had he riden no man mormore ferre
As wel in christendom as in hethnesse
And evevere honoured for his wurthinesse
At Alexander he was whan it was won
Fful ofttime he had the bord begune begunne
Aboven alle nacions in Pruce
In Lettow had he riden and in Ruce
No christenman so ofte of his degre
In Garnade at the sege eke had he be
Of Algazir and riden in Belmary
At Lies was he and at Sataly
Whan thei wer won & in the gret see
At many a noble Armee had he be
At mortal baails had he ben fiftene
And fought for oure feith at Tramassene
In listis thrice & alway slayn his fo
This ilk wurthi knight had ben also
Sumtime with the lord of Palacy
Ayene anothir hethin in Tirky
And evmoreeveremorehe had soveyn price
he was ful wurthi and ful wise
And of his post as meke as a maid
he nevneveryit no vilany said
In al his lif to no maner wight
he was a veray parfit gentil knigt
And forto telle you of his array
his hors were good but he was not gay
Of fustian he ware a gipon
Al besmotird with his haburgeon
Ffor he was late y comcome from his viage
